title: What's behind the Irish impact in the NFL?
description: BBC Sport NI looks at the growing Irish impact in the NFL and the next batch of players hoping to secure a career in American football.
fullText:
At the High Performance Centre in Dublin during the week between Christmas and New Year, approximately 100 kickers and punters, all NFL hopefuls from across the island of Ireland, assembled for a winter training session under the watchful eyes of Tadhg Leader and his staff.

A former rugby fly-half who switched to kicking as a player, Leader now runs an academy helping prospective talent get scholarships in the USA, as well as serving as a coach on the NFL's International Player Pathway (IPP) programme.

While it is a relatively new phenomenon, the prospect of playing college football Stateside before then embarking on a career in the NFL is no longer a pipe dream for the hopefuls in attendance.

In 1985, the Dubliner Neil O'Donoghue ended his eight-year, three-team career at the then St Louis Cardinals, and when Derry's Jude McAtamney took to the field for the New York Giants in November 2024, it bridged a near 40-year gap.

Yet after McAtamney, there was no such wait for the next Irish presence in the league. In December 2025, fellow former GAA player Charlie Smyth, from Mayobridge in County Down, followed in his footsteps.

title: Shedeur Sanders matches Puka Nacua record with his first Pro Bowl selection
description: Shedeur Sanders has reached a rare NFL milestone after being named as a Pro Bowl replacement quarterback. Shedeur Sanders of the Cleveland Browns has been selected to the AFC Pro Bowl roster, replacing Drake Maye, who will be playing the Super Bowl the following weekend.
fullText:
Shedeur Sanders has reached a rare NFL milestone after being named as a Pro Bowl replacement quarterback.

Shedeur Sanders of the Cleveland Browns has been selected to the AFC Pro Bowl roster, replacing Drake Maye, who will be playing the Super Bowl the following weekend.

The recognition caps a late-season rise for Sanders and highlights how uncommon his achievement is in the modern NFL.

Shedeur Sanders became the first fifth-round pick to be named to the Pro Bowl as a rookie since Puka Nacua achieved the feat with the Los Angeles Rams.

The milestone underlines how rare it is for players drafted outside the early rounds to earn league-wide recognition in their first season.

Sanders was added to the AFC Pro Bowl roster as a replacement quarterback after availability issues affected the original selections.

His inclusion placed him in rare company and reinforced the impact he made despite beginning the season outside Cleveland Browns‚Äô starting plans.

Shedeur Sanders started seven games for the Cleveland Browns after not opening the season as the team‚Äôs primary quarterback, finishing with 1,400 passing yards, seven touchdowns, and eight total appearances during a turbulent campaign.

Shedeur Sanders also became the first Browns quarterback to win his first career NFL start since 1995, doing so on the road against the Las Vegas Raiders.

That performance marked the beginning of his late-season involvement and helped reshape expectations around his rookie year.

While Cleveland Browns general manager Andrew Berry has stated the organization will continue to evaluate the quarterback position moving forward, the Pro Bowl selection stands as a defining moment for Sanders.

Matching a milestone previously achieved only by Puka Nacua places his rookie season among the most notable late-round breakthroughs in recent NFL history.

title: NFL.com Mock Draft Puts New Defender on Vikings‚Äô Radar
description: The Super Bowl is in 13 days, but first, the NFL draft community has plenty of time to produce mock [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The Super Bowl is in 13 days, but first, the NFL draft community has plenty of time to produce mock drafts, as seven rounds of new rookies will join the big leagues in three months. And according to NFL.com, the latest and greatest theory for the Minnesota Vikings involves Toledo safety Emmanuel McNeil-Warren.

McNeil-Warren‚Äôs name is rising as a rookie safety option, and the Smith succession question may force Minnesota‚Äôs hand.

McNeil-Warren ranks 39th on the Consensus Big Board as of January 27th, but that didn‚Äôt stop Daniel Jeremiah from mock-drafting him to the purple team.

A Harrison Smith replacement is on the mind of NFL.com.

At the 18th pick, Jeremiah picked McNeil-Warren for Minnesota and noted, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm higher on McNeil-Warren than some other people around the league, but I love his combination of size and explosive playmaking ability. He could help replace Harrison Smith if the soon-to-be 37-year-old does indeed retire.‚Äù

Before the Vikings‚Äô pick, Jeremiah mocked Akheem Mesidor, an EDGE rusher from Miami, to the Detroit Lions, and at No. 19, Arizona State wideout Jordan Tyson landed with the Carolina Panthers.

Naturally, as you will see in every mock draft, Indiana quarterback Fernando Mendoza went No. 1 overall to the Las Vegas Raiders.

McNeil-Warren is 6‚Äô2‚Ä≥ and 202 pounds with 4.5 speed. He‚Äôs got the size. The Toledo Rocket is known for forcing turnovers, which the Vikings could obviously use in 2026 and beyond. He also has the length, burst, and ability worthy of the 1st Round, though general managers often don‚Äôt consider safeties as premium assets, like cornerbacks.

NFL Draft Buzz on McNeil-Warren: ‚ÄúHis combination of length, improving instincts, and proven ability to generate game-changing plays positions him as the type of safety who could thrive in a role-specific capacity early before expanding his responsibilities.‚Äù

‚ÄúThe modern NFL‚Äôs emphasis on versatile defensive backs who can match up with tight ends and provide run support from depth aligns perfectly with his skill set, though defensive coordinators will need patience developing his deep coverage reliability. His ceiling depends heavily on continued refinement of his anticipation and pattern recognition ‚Äì the mental processing that separates good college safeties from NFL starters.‚Äù

Another Toledo defensive back took off after being drafted by the Philadelphia Eagles in 2024: cornerback Quinyon Mitchell.

NBD added on McNeill-Warren, ‚ÄúThe flashes are there, particularly his pick-six against Western Kentucky that demonstrated his growth reading quarterback intentions, but consistency remains elusive. Teams running primarily split-safety coverages where he can work from depth and leverage his closing speed downhill would maximize his immediate impact while minimizing exposure to his weaknesses in isolated deep coverage situations.‚Äù

‚ÄúWhile he may never become an elite single-high free safety, McNeil-Warren possesses the tools and competitive drive to carve out a decade-long career as a valuable chess piece in creative defensive schemes that value versatility and playmaking over pure coverage ability.‚Äù

The Job Lewis Cine Should‚Äôve Filled

It‚Äôs worth noting that the Vikings shouldn‚Äôt need safety right now. The here and now was supposed to be the time that 2022 1st-Rounder Lewis Cine entered his prime. But after Cine broke his leg as a rookie and never gained his footing in the defense thereafter, Minnesota dropped Cine a couple of offseasons ago, one of the worst busts in Vikings history.

Cine now plays in the UFL, along with high-round 2022 draft mate, cornerback Andrew Booth.

Had general manager Kwesi Adofo-Mensah hit on Cine, he would not have to entertain a high-round draft pick on a safety like McNeill-Warren. That‚Äôs why draft busts are so impactful and damning.

Not So Fast on Smith‚Äôs Retirement?

Minnesota extended defensive coordinator Brian Flores‚Äôs contract last week, nominating him for a return in 2026. And while fans had a going-away party for Harrison Smith a few weeks ago in Week 18, a source told VikingsTerritory last weekend that Smith‚Äôs retirement is not a foregone conclusion. The 36-year-old has a ‚Äúhard time walking away,‚Äù per the source, and Flores‚Äôs renewal with the Vikings could lure Smith back for Year No. 15.

If that happens, the Vikings would still need an eventual Smith replacement, but it may not be in the 1st Round of the NFL draft. The team would basically buy itself another year.

Final note: safeties are usually pretty easy to find in free agency. If Minnesota doesn‚Äôt prefer the draft for a safety, about 10 startable options will be available on the open market in March. Players like Kamren Curl (Los Angeles Rams) and Jalen Thompson (Arizona Cardinals) will be available in six weeks if their current teams don‚Äôt renew their contracts.

title: 49ers attack trio of glaring roster holes in new 3-round mock draft
description: The San Francisco 49ers went heavy on their top needs in a three-round 2026 NFL mock draft from the Draft Wire.
fullText:
The San Francisco 49ers have a host of needs to address in the 2026 NFL draft as they continue piecing together an on-the-fly roster transition they hope helps them avoid a full-blown rebuild.

A key piece of their success in that quest will be finding high-level talent via the draft. Free agency will cover some of their roster holes, but the draft is where long-term, sustainable success is found. That's why their trio of selections in a three-round projection from our friends at the Draft Wire make a ton of sense, even if they don't tackle some of the team's most immediate needs.

Here's a quick look at their three picks:

The skinny: Concepcion hauled in 16 touchdowns across two seasons at North Carolina State, including a whopping 10 as a freshman. His numbers dipped some in his second season before transferring to Texas A&M where he found immediate success in the SEC. Last year he hauled in 61 receptions for 919 yards and nine touchdowns. Perhaps the most intriguing part of Concepcion's game is what he can do with the ball in his hands. He racked up 431 yards and three touchdowns on 70 carries in his college career. Concepcion also added punt return duties last season where he tallied a pair of touchdowns on 25 returns.

The skinny: McNeil-Warren would be a really interesting addition for an evolving 49ers defense. His size is evident on film and his production across four years at Toledo is strong. In 48 games he racked up 214 tackles with 11 tackles for loss, five interceptions, 17 pass breakups and nine forced fumbles. His length and athleticism would give San Francisco a new style of safety who can conceivably be a more dynamic option in the back end of their defense than either of the Ji'Ayir Brown-Malik Mustapha duo provides.

The skinny: There's a lot to like just looking at Josephs. His frame is leaner than his 6-3, 240-pound listing would suggest and he brings really good length that he uses to move blockers. His athleticism looks okay on tape, but he looks a little stiff coming off the edge which may be part of the reason he's a third-round projection this early in the draft process. Josephs spent four years at Tennessee and posted 104 tackles, 22 tackles for loss and 9.5 sacks. Josephs also notched four pass breakups and six forced fumbles. More depth on the edge should be a priority in this draft for the 49ers and Josephs has a lot of desirable tools.

title: NFL: Teams still looking for new head coaches
description: As the 2026 season approaches, several NFL teams remain in search of the right leader to guide their next chapter. These openings reflect franchises at different crossroads, whether rebuilding, retooling, or trying to push a talented roster over the top.‚Ä¶
fullText:
As the 2026 season approaches, several NFL teams remain in search of the right leader to guide their next chapter. These openings reflect franchises at different crossroads, whether rebuilding, retooling, or trying to push a talented roster over the top. The decisions made in the coming weeks will shape not only next season, but the long-term direction of each organization.

Arizona‚Äôs opening represents a chance to fully reset the organization‚Äôs direction. The roster has young talent but lacks consistency and identity, making this a pivotal hire. The Cardinals must decide whether to prioritize offensive innovation or cultural rebuilding. Their next coach will likely be tasked with long-term development rather than immediate contention.

The Bills‚Äô vacancy is one of the most attractive jobs on the market due to a strong core and established expectations. However, the pressure to win immediately will narrow the candidate pool. Buffalo needs a leader who can manage high expectations while refining late-game execution. The next coach will be judged quickly by postseason results.

Cleveland‚Äôs search reflects ongoing instability at the top despite roster talent. The Browns need a coach who can unify the locker room and bring clarity to both sides of the ball. Consistency and leadership will matter as much as schematic prowess. This hire could define the franchise‚Äôs direction for years.

The Raiders continue searching for a coach who can stabilize a franchise defined by constant change. Las Vegas needs a strong cultural leader capable of commanding respect in a demanding market. Identity, discipline, and accountability are key priorities. The next hire must balance star power with structure.

For teams still searching, patience and clarity will be just as important as splash or star power. The right hire can stabilize a franchise and establish an identity, while the wrong one can set progress back years. How these teams finish the coaching carousel may ultimately define the balance of the league heading into 2026.

The post NFL: Teams still looking for new head coaches appeared first on The Big Lead.

title: Celebrating one of the greatest nights in Washington's NFL history
description: The 1991 Washington team is arguably the greatest in NFL history.
fullText:
It doesn't seem possible, but it was actually 34 years ago on Monday.

That's right, I remember it so well. It was January 26, 1992, in Super Bowl XXVI, and Washington jumped out to a 17-0 halftime lead over the Buffalo Bills. On the Bills' first second-half possession, linebacker Kurt Gouveia intercepted a Jim Kelly pass, nearly returning it for a touchdown. Gerald Riggs hammered the ball into the end zone, and it was 24-0 Redskins.

REDEMPTION!
January 26, 1992

Four years after "The Fumble" in the AFC Championship with the #Browns in Denver, running back Earnest Byner scores the first touchdown of Super Bowl XXVI en route to the Redskins' third Super Bowl title.#HTTR #RaiseHail pic.twitter.com/FWP0mbSpwV

‚Äî Kevin Gallagher (@KevG163) January 26, 2026

Early in the final quarter, Mark Rypien, Earnest Byner, the Hogs, and the Posse (Art Monk, Gary Clark, Ricky Sanders), Charles Mann, Wilber Marshall, Darrell Green, and the rest of the Redskins were destroying the AFC Champion Bills 37-10. The game's final several minutes were anticlimactic, much less intense, with cameras showing Redskins on the sidelines laughing and enjoying themselves on their way to another Super Bowl championship, as the Bills scored two late scores for a 37-24 final.

It was Joe Jackson Gibbs' fourth Super Bowl with Washington and the third he had won. He had amazingly won those three Super Bowls with three different starting quarterbacks who were not Hall of Fame quarterbacks (Joe Theismann, Doug Williams, Mark Rypien). He also won with three different starting running backs (John Riggins, Timmy Smith, Earnest Byner). OT Joe Jacoby, C Jeff Bostic, WR Art Monk, TE Don Warren, G Russ Grimm and LB Monte Coleman played on all four of those Gibbs teams.

Since that time Washington head coaches have been Richie Petitbon, Norv Turner, Terry Robiskie, Marty Schottenheimer, Steve Spurrier, Joe Gibbs again (2004-2007), Jim Zorn, Mike Shanahan, Jay Gruden, Bill Callahan, Ron Rivera, and Dan Quinn.

Yes, a lot has changed for Washington in the last 34 years, sadly, even the name.

This article originally appeared on Commanders Wire: Washington Commanders: 34 years ago was franchise's last Super Bowl

title: Former Lions GM gets new job with Atlanta Falcons
description: Former Detroit Lions GM Bob Quinn has built out an interesting career arc in the NFL.
fullText:
It‚Äôs probably been a while since you‚Äôve heard the name Bob Quinn, but the former Detroit Lions general manager is back in the news.

After the Lions parted ways with Quinn in the middle of the 2020 season, he eventually joined the Cleveland Browns as a senior consultant. The next year, he was promoted to senior personnel/coaching executive, allowing him to work on both the coaching and team personnel side of the business.

But with the Browns‚Äô latest regime dissolved in the midst of a new head coaching search, Quinn is leaving the organization and following former Browns head coach Kevin Stefanski to the Atlanta Falcons. His new role appears to be solely on the coaching side, as his title is senior advisor to the head coach.

It‚Äôs an interesting career arc for Quinn, who had worked solely on the personnel side of the business when he joined the Lions in 2016. He rose up the ranks in the New England Patriots‚Äô scouting department for 15 years before landing the general manager job with the Lions. His time in Detroit was very mixed. On one hand, he made some impressive picks along the offensive line (Taylor Decker, Graham Glasgow, Frank Ragnow). On the other hand, he‚Äôll always be haunted by the picks of Jarrad Davis, Teez Tabor, Jahlani Tavai, and Jeff Okudah. What ultimately sank his career the most was the decision to hire Matt Patricia as the team‚Äôs head coach‚Äîa disaster that set the franchise back several years.

But it speaks volumes that Stefanski‚Äîa two-time AP NFL Coach of the Year‚Äîtrusts Quinn as his right-hand man on the coaching side of football. It appears Quinn has done a good job building out a new career within the NFL world.

title: Deion Sanders shows NFL-style system of fines for Colorado players
description: Colorado coach Deion Sanders to fine players for tardiness, attendance issues as college sports gets more professional
fullText:
Colorado football coach Deion Sanders has laid out an NFL-style system of fines for his players if they violate team rules, including $500 for being late to practice.

He showed it on the video screen in his first team meeting of 2026 on Jan. 23, as briefly seen in a video posted by his oldest son, Deion Jr. Here is what it said:

Late to meeting or film session: $400

No-show to meeting or film session: $2,000

Late to strength and conditioning workout: $1,000

No-show to strength and conditioning workout: $1,500

Violation of team rules: $1,000-$2,500 based on severity.

Public or social media misconduct: $2,000-$5,000

Damage to university or team property: repair cost +$3,000

Loss of team technology or equipment: replacement cost +$1,000

Players also are required to wear Nike shoes and apparel while representing the university at practices, games and organized team activities. Colorado has been a Nike-sponsored school since 1995. Sanders also is sponsored by Nike. Failure to comply also could result in disciplinary action.

There is an appeal process for players, with final decisions issued within five business days. But it's another example of the professionalization of college sports, with players this year getting paid directly by schools for use of their name, image and likeness (NIL).

A lack of discipline also apparently was an issue for Colorado last year, when the Buffaloes finished 3-9 during Sanders‚Äô third season in charge.

‚ÄúAll these lates and tardies and all these things, we can‚Äôt have that this year,‚Äù Colorado receivers coach Jason Phillips told the team. ‚ÄúThose are the things we will eliminate‚Ä¶ Two ways to eliminate that. Either you change, or we change you.‚Äù

Sanders has brought in 42 new scholarship transfer players this year, offsetting more than 35 scholarship players who transferred out.

‚ÄúYou all are hand-picked, hand-picked, hand-picked,‚Äù Sanders told the team. ‚ÄúWe watched darn near every one of y‚Äôall.‚Äù

Follow reporter Brent Schrotenboer @Schrotenboer. Email: bschrotenb@usatoday.com

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Deion Sanders reveals fines for Colorado players who break rules

title: Fantasy Football Stock Watch: These 5 players are on the rise after the NFL Playoffs
description: With the NFL Playoffs in the books and the Super Bowl on the horizon, Scott Pianowski takes a look at a quintet of players who have boosted their stock.
fullText:
The fantasy football season effectively ended a month ago, but it‚Äôs important to scout the NFL playoff games as potential clues for 2026 value. Today, let‚Äôs discuss some players who have improved their stock since it got cold, be it with late-December rallies or impressive showings in the postseason.

Give Mike Vrabel credit for not mothballing Stevenson after some early-season fumbling issues. The Patriots hitched up to Stevenson in the playoffs, giving him 45 touches the last two weeks, including 25 in the AFC Championship win over the Broncos. He currently has 194 rushing yards for the playoffs, tops in the NFL.

Meanwhile, TreVeyon Henderson saw just three opportunities (three forgettable runs) in the victory at Denver. Henderson was the home-run hitter in this backfield most of the year, with Stevenson the steady grinder; come playoff time, the Pats have leaned into the grinder. And Stevenson was trusted much 

Figure on Stevenson getting a bell cow workload in the Super Bowl, and earning the higher ADP in next summer‚Äôs draft season.

Everyone remembers his ‚Äúhello world‚Äù moment, the 6-118-2 detonation at Cincinnati, including the game-winning touchdown. But the Bears didn‚Äôt completely hand Loveland the keys to the kingdom until after Christmas. He absorbed 48 targets over his final four games (including the playoffs), good for a 28-378-2 log.

This is going to push Loveland into pricy areas for next year‚Äôs fantasy drafts, but I‚Äôm here for it. Caleb Williams is also on the escalator and Ben Johnson is the right man with the play sheet.

Sean McVay usually employs a very narrow offense for fantasy purposes, relying on just a handful of skill players. But that tree expanded during the 2025 season, with Corum starting to become a proactive complement to starting RB Kyren Williams. Corum was the team‚Äôs most effective back in Sunday‚Äôs loss at Seattle (12 touches, 79 scrimmage yards), and he received double-digit touches in six of his final eight games. Corum also had six touchdowns on the year, with five of them coming after Thanksgiving.

The Rams haven‚Äôt soured on Williams and he‚Äôll be the clear starter entering 2026. But Corum probably has 8-12 touch equity in any game where he‚Äôs healthy, and he‚Äôll shoot past that projection every now and then, if the Rams want to steer into a hot hand. Corum is on the flex radar for 2026 fantasy planning, and he‚Äôs just one injury away from being a needle mover, too.

I don‚Äôt know how to quit this guy. Mims was an afterthought for most of the year but he was forced into action during the playoffs, coming through with a nifty 12-155-1 line on 14 targets. I get it, the Broncos have a crowded receiver room, and Troy Franklin and Pat Bryant are still ascending talents. But let‚Äôs not forget that Mims will only be 24 next year, too. Mims has already scored 11 regular-season touchdowns despite limited opportunities, and he‚Äôs dynamic as a kick returner. He‚Äôs screaming for a bigger role.

Just making the NFL as an undrafted receiver out of Holy Cross is a big win for Coker, but he‚Äôs not content to stop there. He stepped forward in his final six starts, posting a 28-378-4 log, including that 134-yard explosion against the Rams. Coker has good size and the ability to high point the ball, which gives him the potential to score 8-10 touchdowns in a full season, even with Tetairoa McMillan already on the team. Coker will be a trendy fantasy sleeper next summer, but I‚Äôll still try to get a seat near the front of that bandwagon.

title: When Is the 2026 Super Bowl? All About the NFL Championship Game, Including Who's Playing and Performing
description: The Seattle Seahawks will face off against the New England Patriots in the 2026 Super Bowl on Feb. 8
fullText:
After winning their respective conference championship games on Jan. 25, the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots punched their tickets to Super Bowl LX

The NFL championship game will take place on Feb. 8 at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, Calif.

Green Day, Charlie Puth and Bad Bunny will take the Super Bowl 2026 stage

The Seattle Seahawks and New England Patriots are set to face off in football's biggest showdown.

Held on Feb. 8 at Levi's Stadium in Santa Clara, Calif., the 2026 Super Bowl will not only crown this year's NFL champion but also mark 60 years since the first game was played. To commemorate the milestone, Green Day will deliver a special opening performance before the teams take center stage, ushering generations of Super Bowl MVPs onto the field.

‚ÄúCelebrating 60 years of Super Bowl history with Green Day as a hometown band, while honoring the NFL legends who‚Äôve helped define this sport, is an incredibly powerful way to kick off Super Bowl LX,‚Äù Tim Tubito, the league‚Äôs senior director of event and game presentation, told the Associated Press in January 2026.

Though fans are amped for the 2026 Super Bowl's musical stars ‚Äî which also include Charlie Puth and Bad Bunny ‚Äî the main act will be on the field.

Patriots quarterback Drake Maye will lead the team back to the Super Bowl for the first time since 2019, giving the franchise a chance at its seventh title and its first without Tom Brady and Bill Belichick. On the other side, Seattle returns to the Super Bowl with Sam Darnold at the helm, looking to secure its second Lombardi Trophy after winning its first in 2014.

Here's everything to know about the 2026 Super Bowl, including the full performance lineup.

Super Bowl LX is scheduled for Sunday, Feb. 8, 2026.

This year's NFL championship game will be held at Levi's Stadium, home to the San Francisco 49ers, in Santa Clara, Calif.

While the Patriots' last Super Bowl appearance was a win in 2019, the Seahawks' last championship game was in 2015 ‚Äî when they lost 28-24 against the Patriots. The Seahawks have previously made three total appearances in the Super Bowl ‚Äî 2006, 2014 and 2015 ‚Äî and won once, in 2014.

Meanwhile, the Patriots have made 11 appearances in the Super Bowl ‚Äî more than any other team ‚Äî and won six games. If they win in February, they will have the most ever wins in Super Bowl history.

While all six wins have previously taken place during Brady and Belichick's era, Maye emphasized the team‚Äôs fresh chapter after the Patriots beat the Denver Broncos 10-7 at the AFC Championship game on Jan. 25.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a new team, it‚Äôs a new era,‚Äù he told Boston.com. ‚ÄúI respect and appreciate what the Patriots dynasty did, and unfortunately they didn‚Äôt come out with some wins here, but we changed that narrative and look forward to bringing our best football for [the Super Bowl].‚Äù

In September 2025, the NFL announced that Bad Bunny (born Benito Antonio Mart√≠nez Ocasio) would perform at the 2026 Super Bowl Halftime Show. The "MONACO" rapper shared his excitement about the honor in a statement at the time.

‚ÄúWhat I'm feeling goes beyond myself," he explained. "It's for those who came before me and ran countless yards so I could come in and score a touchdown‚Ä¶ this is for my people, my culture, and our history. Ve y dile a tu abuela, que seremos el HALFTIME SHOW DEL SUPER BOWL.‚Äù

Fans will also be treated to a lineup of killer performances before the game even starts. Green Day will kick off the events with an opening ceremony to "welcome the MVPs who‚Äôve shaped the game and open the night for fans all over the world," frontman Billie Joe Armstrong said in a statement.

After that, Puth will sing the national anthem, followed by 11-time Grammy winner Brandi Carlile performing "America the Beautiful." Coco Jones will also give a rendition of "Lift Every Voice and Sing" to close out the pregame ceremony.

According to the NFL, the 2026 Super Bowl kicks off at 6:30 p.m. ET / 3:30 p.m. PT. Green Day's opening ceremony performance will start airing a half-hour earlier at 6 p.m. ET / 3 p.m. PT.

Those who aren't catching the game live in California can watch it broadcast on NBC and Telemundo, per the NFL. Fans can also tune in on the NFL app or stream the game on Peacock.

title: Why NFL fans believe 'script writers' predicted Super Bowl 60 matchup with preseason graphic
description: The Super Bowl 60 matchup was unpredictable. Or was it?
fullText:
Why NFL fans believe 'script writers' predicted Super Bowl 60 matchup with preseason graphic originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

For a few years, there existed a conspiracy theory that the colors of the Super Bowl logo predicted which two teams would play for the Lombardi Trophy.

Well, that one is out, and a new theory is in.

Some NFL fans believe a preseason graphic the league posted to its social media accounts actually predicted the seemingly unpredictable Super Bowl 60 matchup between the New England Patriots and Seattle Seahawks, two teams that hadn't won a playoff game since 2019 before this season.

Here's a look at the graphic behind the NFL's newest "script writer" conspiracy theory.

MORE:Super Bowl 60 odds, spread as Seahawks open as favorites

After the Patriots and Seahawks punched their ticket to the Super Bowl, fans started to notice which two quarterbacks seem to be closer to the giant Lombardi Trophy than the rest in this graphic posted by the NFL on the first day of the regular season:

‚Äî RedditCFB (@RedditCFB) January 26, 2026

A closer inspection reveals you can make the case Baker Mayfield was actually closer than Darnold, or that Travis Hunter seems to be the closest to the trophy.

This is no time for facts, though. NFL fans have unearthed the latest grand Super Bowl conspiracy, and it's true that Maye and Darnold were both front and center in relation to the Lombardi Trophy in the graphic just as they are in reality today.

"They really gave us the script in September," the lead Drake Maye fan account tweeted Sunday night.

They really gave us the script in September https://t.co/ofeVgBdbPb

‚Äî Drake Maye Lover (@drakemayeloverr) January 26, 2026

Another look at the graphic reveals the NFL probably believed a Patriots-Seahawks Super Bowl was enormously unlikely. The sport's biggest names are front-and-center, from Saquon Barkley and Patrick Mahomes to Brock Purdy and Joe Burrow. Lamar Jackson and Josh Allen are also closer to Mahomes and Barkley than they are to Maye and Darnold in the distance.

Considering players from the Jacksonville Jaguars, New York Giants and Tennessee Titans are standing nearly shoulder-to-shoulder with Maye and Darnold in the distance, it seems more like the league discounted the Patriots and Seahawks than predicted their Super Bowl 60 meeting.

Why let the finer details get in the way of a good conspiracy theory, though?

title: Will Patriots Make NFL History In Super Bowl Vs. Seahawks?
description: After edging the Denver Broncos 10-7 in the AFC Championship Game on Sunday, the New England Patriots are Super Bowl-bound. Again. This marks the 10th Super Bowl appearance for the Patriots in the last 25 seasons and their 12th in franchise history. New England has won six championships so far, all with Tom Brady and [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
After edging the Denver Broncos 10-7 in the AFC Championship Game on Sunday, the New England Patriots are Super Bowl-bound.

This marks the 10th Super Bowl appearance for the Patriots in the last 25 seasons and their 12th in franchise history. New England has won six championships so far, all with Tom Brady and Bill Belichick.

If the Patriots get their seventh Super Bowl win in two weeks, it will be the most in NFL history, breaking a tie with the Pittsburgh Steelers. Their 12 appearances are already a record.

The Steelers also have six Lombardi Trophies, with their most recent one coming during the 2008 campaign. Four of their rings came during the 1970s, however, so New England has been the far more successful franchise recently.

Patriots 

Last 25 years 

Have more than 2X the amount of Super Bowl appearances as the next 2 teams COMBINED 

1. Patriots ‚Äì 10

2. Chiefs ‚Äì 5
3. Eagles ‚Äì 4

Domination pic.twitter.com/ytHekrXraG

‚Äî bostonsportsinf (@jsgiii22661) January 25, 2026

Pittsburgh hasn‚Äôt even won a playoff game since early 2017. losing seven straight postseason games. The Patriots have reached four Super Bowls and won two during that time.

While New England has NFL history at stake, so does its head coach, Mike Vrabel. A three-time Super Bowl champ with the Patriots as a player, he has a chance to become the first person in NFL history to win a Super Bowl as a player and a coach with the same franchise.

To do that, they‚Äôll have to go through the Seattle Seahawks, who are out for revenge after narrowly losing their last Super Bowl appearance to New England on Malcolm Butler‚Äôs goal-line interception 11 years ago. The Seahawks will have to overcome that painful history along with Sam Darnold‚Äôs embarrassing 0-4 career record against the Patriots.

Darnold will need to step up against New England‚Äôs historically good defense, which is averaging just 8.7 points per game allowed in these playoffs. Meanwhile, the Patriots have already beaten three elite defenses this postseason, so there‚Äôs no reason they can‚Äôt defeat another.

title: Seahawks News: Mike Macdonald Says Sam Darnold ‚ÄúShut a Lot of People Up‚Äù With 3-TD Game vs. Rams
description: Once the No. 3 overall pick in the 2018 NFL Draft, Sam Darnold‚Äôs career seemed destined to be remembered as a cautionary tale.
fullText:
Once the No. 3 overall pick in the 2018 NFL Draft, Sam Darnold‚Äôs career seemed destined to be remembered as a cautionary tale. He was labeled a bust with the New York Jets, flamed out in Carolina, faded into the background in San Francisco, and was ultimately discarded by the Minnesota Vikings. Eight seasons later, that narrative is officially dead.

On Sunday night, Darnold delivered the defining performance of his career, throwing for 346 yards and three touchdowns to lead the Seattle Seahawks to a 31‚Äì27 win over the Los Angeles Rams in the NFC Championship Game. The victory sends Seattle to Super Bowl LX. And sends Darnold‚Äôs critics scrambling.

‚ÄúI mean, he just shut a lot of people up tonight,‚Äù Seahawks head coach Mike Macdonald said after the game. ‚ÄúSo I‚Äôm really happy for him.‚Äù

Darnold was sensational from start to finish, matching throws with MVP candidate Matthew Stafford on the game‚Äôs biggest stage. He connected with Jaxon Smith-Njigba for a momentum-swinging touchdown with 20 seconds left in the first half, flipping the game in Seattle‚Äôs favor.

Following a disastrous Rams special teams mistake, Darnold capitalized by firing a strike to Jake Bobo over the middle for another score. Later, he ripped a perfectly placed spiral through Los Angeles‚Äô zone coverage to Cooper Kupp for a 13-yard touchdown, the play that ultimately proved decisive.

The performance was a masterclass in poise and precision. Darnold finished 25-of-36 passing with zero interceptions, repeatedly delivering when the moment demanded it most.

Seattle complemented Darnold‚Äôs brilliance with timely defense and game-changing special teams. Devon Witherspoon made back-to-back pass breakups inside the six-yard line late in the fourth quarter, forcing a turnover on downs that kept the Rams off the scoreboard.

On special teams, the Seahawks forced two muffed punts from Rams returner Xavier Smith, recovering the second to set up Darnold‚Äôs touchdown pass to Bobo.

‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a team win,‚Äù Macdonald said. ‚ÄúAnd then, you can‚Äôt talk about the game without talking about our quarterback.‚Äù

For Darnold, this marks his first NFC Championship win as a starter. He previously earned a conference title as a backup with the 49ers during their Super Bowl run two years ago, but this one was different ‚Äî this one was his.

After five teams, nearly 3,000 pass attempts, and almost eight full seasons in the league, Darnold has become the first quarterback from the vaunted 2018 draft class, which included Baker Mayfield and MVPs Josh Allen and Lamar Jackson, to win a conference championship as a starter.

When his best was required, Sam Darnold delivered it. Two weeks from now in Santa Clara, he‚Äôll have a chance to put the final stamp on a career resurrection that once seemed impossible.

The post Seahawks News: Mike Macdonald Says Sam Darnold ‚ÄúShut a Lot of People Up‚Äù With 3-TD Game vs. Rams appeared first on The SportsRush.

title: Iit's inexcusable for facemask fouls to be immune from replay review
description: As the NFL makes more and more officiating misses subject to replay review, the lingering blind spots become more and more glaring.
fullText:
As the NFL makes more and more officiating misses subject to replay review, the lingering blind spots become more and more glaring.

It's time (in fact, it's long overdue) for missed facemask fouls to be called via replay.

There's no reason not to do it. Replay currently can be used to undo an erroneous facemask call. Why shouldn't it be used when a clear and obvious foul was missed?

It happened during the second quarter of Sunday's NFC Championship, when Rams quarterback Matthew Stafford had his facemask grabbed on a third-down sack that forced a field goal. If the penalty hadn't been missed, the Rams would have gotten 15 yards and a fresh set of downs.

Some would say the NFL resists using replay to put a flag on the field. From its inception, however, the current replay rules have allowed a penalty to be called for having too many men on the field.

Today, too many things are reviewable to justify omitting something that requires no subjectivity. And it's eventually going to affect a huge game, in a huge spot.

It affected today's huge NFC Championship, ending a potential touchdown drive that could have tied the game at 10 and forcing the Rams to settle for three. And it's a flaw that can easily be fixed.

title: What are overtime rules in NFL playoffs for Conference Championships?
description: The 2026 NFL playoffs continue, and this is how the overtime rules are different.
fullText:
The 2026 NFL playoffs are upon us, with the NFC and AFC title games on tap, and as the stakes change so do the overtime rules. Let's dive into exactly how before the final two pre-Super Bowl games get going.

Both teams get at least one possession in overtime, a rule change made after the controversial 2022 AFC Championship game. The Buffalo Bills lost that one to the Kansas City Chiefs after failing to get a possession in overtime, as you might recall.

A playoff game also cannot end in a tie, so if the score is even after the first overtime period, the teams will play as many are needed for a winner to emerge. Between each overtime period a two-minute intermission will take place. Additionally, the second and fourth overtime periods are subject to the same timing rules as the second and fourth regulation periods.

Like the regular season, overtime will not feature any instant replay coach's challenges as all reviews are initiated by the replay official.

No playoff games went to overtime last season, so perhaps we're due for some this year. There's nothing better than some extra football, especially in the playoffs.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Overtime rules for NFL playoffs in NFC, AFC conference championships

title: Why Former Pro Bowler Sees ‚ÄòNo Ceiling‚Äô For Patriots‚Äô Drake Maye
description: It‚Äôs a scary thought for the NFL that Drake Maye hasn‚Äôt necessarily reached his full potential. Maye can conclude his second season with a Super Bowl appearance if the New England Patriots defeat the Denver Broncos on Sunday. The 23-year-old quarterback is also an MVP finalist after completing 72 percent of his passes for 4,394 [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
It‚Äôs a scary thought for the NFL that Drake Maye hasn‚Äôt necessarily reached his full potential.

Maye can conclude his second season with a Super Bowl appearance if the New England Patriots defeat the Denver Broncos on Sunday. The 23-year-old quarterback is also an MVP finalist after completing 72 percent of his passes for 4,394 yards and 31 touchdowns.

Capturing a Lombardi Trophy could help establish Maye as one of the league‚Äôs premier signal-callers. When asked how good he could become during CBS‚Äôs pre-game coverage of the AFC Championship Game, former Pro Bowl offensive lineman Kyle Long declared that the sky is the limit.

‚ÄúThere is no ceiling,‚Äù Long said. ‚ÄúFrom a physical standpoint, from a personality standpoint, from a toughness standpoint, he checks all the boxes.‚Äù

Maye endured an uneven rookie campaign for the 4-13 Patriots, but they‚Äôve reversed that record behind an improved roster. Long celebrated Maye‚Äôs maturation alongside a bolstered supporting cast and praised the North Carolina native‚Äôs humility.

‚ÄúHe‚Äôs proved it all season long,‚Äù Long added. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs unbelievably accurate, but I think the thing that stands out the most ‚Ä¶ his personality. He‚Äôs got an ‚ÄòAw shucks‚Äô about him.‚Äù

Maye has been far from perfect this postseason, losing three of six fumbles and throwing an interception in each game. However, he also averaged 9.2 yards per pass attempt in a 16-3 win over the Los Angeles Chargers and tossed three touchdowns against the Houston Texans‚Äô No. 1-ranked defense in the AFC Divisional Round.

Surviving another stout Broncos defense could help Maye quickly stamp his place in Patriots lore and continue his ascension to superstardom.

title: NFL play-off predictions - who will make the Super Bowl?

fullText:
It's Championship Sunday with one final hurdle to overcome on the road to Super Bowl 60, but who will make it through to Santa Clara?

The big story is the Denver Broncos having to play back-up quarterback Jarrett Stidham, the first man to start a Championship game without throwing a single pass for two seasons.

title: If Aaron Rodgers wants to play, Steelers' hire of Mike McCarthy reboots an option for the QB
description: Those familiar with the pair have told Yahoo Sports in recent months that the rekindled admiration is real. But burying the hatchet in the NFL guarantees nothing.
fullText:
Heading into Week 18, Aaron Rodgers was nothing if not pragmatically optimistic.

The days on his Pittsburgh Steelers contract were dwindling. The future of head coach Mike Tomlin was a subject of public debate. And the franchise he quarterbacked was cornered into a de facto playoff game against the Baltimore Ravens in the regular-season finale. Any direction you looked, there was something finite hanging in the balance. But in what registered in at least a mild surprise, Rodgers spoke to reporters like a man who didn‚Äôt see a definitive near-term conclusion to his football career ‚Ä¶ so long as he didn‚Äôt want it to end.

‚ÄúI‚Äôm thinking about this week, but obviously I‚Äôm 42 years old and I‚Äôm on a one-year deal, so you know what the situation is,‚Äù Rodgers told reporters. ‚ÄúWhenever the season ends, I‚Äôll be a free agent. So that‚Äôll give me a lot of options if I still want to play.‚Äù

Rodgers gave a slight shrug and chuckled.

‚ÄúNot a lot of options, but ‚Äî there will be options I would think. Maybe one or two if I decide I still want to play.‚Äù

[Get more Steelers news: Pittsburgh team feed]

He then punctuated the thought by opening the door to a return.

‚ÄúI‚Äôve enjoyed this experience,‚Äù Rodgers said. ‚ÄúEverybody in Pittsburgh has been fantastic to me on and off the field. It‚Äôs really what I was hoping for, for this experience. It‚Äôs been even better than I was hoping.‚Äù

A few days later, the Steelers would beat the Ravens and make the postseason, before getting bounced in the first round of the playoffs against the Houston Texans. All in all, it culminated in a season that felt like Rodgers, Tomlin and the Steelers squeezed about as much as they could have expected.

Then Tomlin left, via a resignation that felt like a surprise to ownership. And maybe to Rodgers, too, given that any thought of his return seemed so strongly bound to whether Tomlin would continue to guide Pittsburgh. When that changed, logical speculation ‚Äî and that‚Äôs all we‚Äôve been left with thus far on the Rodgers front ‚Äî was that a new head coach would mean a new quarterback. Whatever options were on the table for Rodgers, they appeared to have shrunk by one.

Then came Saturday, when the Steelers went against their historical hiring template and locked in 62-year-old Mike McCarthy, a candidate who can fit more than one forward-looking ideology.¬† On one hand, McCarthy is a seasoned veteran coach who can come in and try to energize an aging roster that is still very much built to win now. On the other, he could be tasked with developing the franchise‚Äôs next young quarterback. Without a bridge starter currently on the roster, it will be difficult for McCarthy to achieve both of those responsibilities.

Unless, of course, McCarthy can find a veteran who knows his system and can come in and help with both tasks. Maybe a quarterback who McCarthy previously helped develop into a star? One who already has spent a season in the Pittsburgh quarterback room with 24-year-old Will Howard, who showed promise in limited reps during his rookie preseason and has the support of the front office as a prospect worth some continued development?

That sounds like a fit for Rodgers. And perhaps the renewal of a 2026 option that appeared to be extinguished when Tomlin resigned.

Of course, that doesn‚Äôt mean McCarthy was hired with any kind of specificity of luring Rodgers back for another season. While some of Pittsburgh‚Äôs players gave Rodgers high marks as a teammate in their exit interviews, the work to find the next long-term starting option is clearly near the top of the priorities for ownership and general manager Omar Khan. And that wouldn‚Äôt have changed even if Tomlin had remained. One way or another, 2026 was always going to be geared toward either figuring out if the next young quarterback is already on the roster (in the form of Howard) or if the Steelers liked any of their draft, trade or free-agency options.

McCarthy‚Äôs arrival won‚Äôt change that mindset. The real factors of change at the quarterback spot will instead be pressed against the options Pittsburgh has available. If McCarthy is a head coach Rodgers will play for, it gives Pittsburgh at least one more year of a bridge starter to either weigh Howard as a prospect, or find someone in the 2026 draft who is worthy of being selected and then groomed. And there‚Äôs certainly some deep-value intrigue over the coming draft class of quarterbacks.

The Steelers won‚Äôt have a shot at Indiana‚Äôs Fernando Mendoza and their first-round draft pick at No. 21 overall might not be high enough to land Alabama‚Äôs Ty Simpson, either. But after that tandem, there are some interesting quarterbacks who could be seen as worthwhile projects with upside. Mississippi‚Äôs Trinidad Chambliss (if he can‚Äôt force another year of NCAA eligibility) will draw a significant amount of study from NFL teams. As will a quartet of others who were previously considered to be first-round picks ‚Äî and potentially very high first-round picks ‚Äî until hitting stumbles in their final seasons: LSU‚Äôs Garrett Nussmeier, Miami‚Äôs Carson Beck, Penn State‚Äôs Drew Allar and Clemson‚Äôs Cade Klubnik, among others.

For now ‚Äî and we‚Äôve yet to go through the draft sifting process, so take this with a grain of salt ‚Äî only Mendoza cuts the figure as a Day 1 rookie starter. Simpson could round into that kind of prospect, or one who has a shot to earn a starting job during his rookie season. The rest? Most personnel opinions appear to be placing them on a developmental track to possibly get a shot with a year or more of work from further down the depth chart.

If any of those players are in the Steelers‚Äô future, McCarthy‚Äôs hiring makes a lot of sense given his history with helping quarterbacks grow into starters. And it also makes sense that Rodgers would be a fit, so long as he continues to be in a year-to-year contract mindset and actually wants to play for McCarthy again.

In that latter vein, both McCarthy and Rodgers have said very nice things about each other in the least few years, each gaining the perspective of working with new people and in new places. Those familiar with the pair have told Yahoo Sports in recent months that the rekindled admiration is real, with both having come to terms with their own mistakes and frustrations that ultimately played a part in McCarthy getting fired late in the 2018 season after coaching the Green Bay Packers for nearly 13 years.

But burying the hatchet in the NFL guarantees nothing. Even if Rodgers wants to play again and McCarthy would like to have him in 2026, the veteran quarterback doesn‚Äôt know what the rest of the league landscape will look like in even a few weeks. There‚Äôs a chance the Los Angeles Rams win a Super Bowl and Matthew Stafford decides to pull a John Elway and retire. Should that happen, the Rams will still be very much in the middle of a Super Bowl window and not have an obvious starting quarterback on the roster. And then there is the Minnesota Vikings, a team Rodgers was very interested in playing for last offseason. They are looking for someone to come in and compete with J.J. McCarthy for the starting job next season.

Add the Steelers to that mix, and you have exactly what Rodgers was talking about when he focused his gaze on 2026. Not a lot of options ‚Äî but certainly some interesting ones.

title: Micah's predictions for USC stars on NFL Championship Sunday
description: Sam Darnold can make USC history. Other Trojans will play huge roles as they all try to make the Super Bowl
fullText:
We are one week closer to the conclusion of the NFL playoffs. This weekend will determine which two teams will make it to the Super Bowl. In both games, the former USC Trojans will play a huge factor and have their fingerprints all over games with the Super Bowl up for grabs. Sam Darnold not only has his legacy on the line, but also a chance to represent his alma mater for the first time on the NFL's biggest stage.

Here are my predictions for championship weekend in the NFL:

Sam Darnold and the Seahawks will enter the biggest game in recent memory for the former NFC juggernaut. This time around, they enter with a defense similar to the Legion of Boom but an offense that is more well-rounded. Seattle has looked miles ahead of the other playoff teams left. I think the Rams will give them a challenge and this game will come down to the last drive, but Seattle has proven themselves to be the better team between the two teams in this matchup. They can blowout teams, they can win close, low-score games, and they can win shootouts. I think this game, Sam Darnold, and the Seahawks offense will have to be at its best, but I think Darnold will deliver the best quarterback performance in this matchup. Seattle will move on and represent the NFC in the Super Bowl.

Many might gift wrap this win to the Patriots with Bo Nix being out for the rest of the season, but I disagree. I think the Patriots come out on top, but they will have to work for this game. The Broncos' defense will need former USC Trojan Talanoa Hufanga to fly around and make plays all day. The Patriots' offense has struggled to keep Drake Maye upright in each of their playoff games. Maye has been sacked 5 times. That is where the Broncos' defense specializes. Their defensive line can get after their quarterback like no other. The Broncos' defense will keep them in this game; it will come down to whether or not he can put together his best Nick Foles impression. I think he will play well, but not well enough to win this football game. I think he will come up short late and throw a costly interception, and Drake Maye and Mike Vrabel will iron out this victory in a low-scoring defensive battle.

I think Sam Darnold saves his biggest performance for the game right before the Super Bowl. Darnold squeaked by Stafford and the Rams in the last meeting between the two teams in an overtime win. Darnold will have to play exactly like he did down the stretch in that game to get the victory in this one. I think Darnold reaches 300 yards through the air, and he and Jaxon Smith-Njigba light up the Rams' secondary. This secondary has given up their fair share of big games to their opponent. This game will be no different. Jaxon Smith-Njigba will have over 100 yards receiving, and he will connect with Sam Darnold for two touchdowns in this game. I think Darnold and Jaxon Smith-Njigba have the two biggest performances in the NFC Championship game.

In the AFC, I think pass rusher Nik Bonitto has the most dominant performance. The Patriots have given up 5 sacks in each of their playoff games. In the last game versus the Texans, Danielle Hunter and Will Anderson Jr. combined for 5 sacks. Bonitto this season had 14 sacks. I think he will have 3 sacks in this game and disrupt Drake Maye all game long.

I think defensive tackle Milton Williams will also have himself a big game and disrupt the Broncos on the other end. Williams has been a huge reason for the Patriots' defensive turnaround, and he was great all regular season long. He creates pressure from the interior with the best of them, and he is a great run stopper. I think he will lead this Patriots defensive line to make the Broncos one-dimensional and take out their run game. Williams will also lead the Patriots in sacks with two. Verus the Chargers, Williams had two sacks, and against the Texans, he was an irritant all game long, forcing the pick 6 that took the momentum away from Houston initially. I think Milton Williams will use all of that to have his best playoff game with the Patriots and help send his team to the Super Bowl.

My Super Bowl matchup prediction is the New England Patriots taking on the Seattle Seahawks. The Patriots have had quite the Super Bowl run vs tough defenses, but they still will not be prepared for the Seahawks' defense. Mike Macdonald and the Seahawks defense will make it a tough day for young star quarterback Drake Maye. I think his age and inexperience will come back to bite him in this match. I think Rashid Shaheed will pay homage to Devin Hester and take the opening kickoff back for a touchdown, setting the tone for the entire game. I think Darnold will not have to do much to be the top quarterback on the field, but he still will put up a respectable performance. Seattle will play their last complete performance of the season, getting their Super Bowl victory. Darnold will look to be greedy and not just settle for being the first Trojan quarterback to start in the Super Bowl, but he will also become the first Trojan quarterback to win a Super Bowl.

This article originally appeared on Trojans Wire: Predictions for USC on championship weekend in NFL playoffs

title: Jarrett Stidham explains why he re-signed with Broncos in 2025
description: Jarrett Stidham drew interest from other NFL teams during free agency, but he opted to re-sign with the Broncos. This is why.
fullText:
Jarrett Stidham chose to remain with the Denver Broncos last offseason.

With his initial two-year deal set to expire last March, Stidham drew interest from other NFL teams ‚Äî including the New England Patriots ‚Äî but he opted to re-sign with the Broncos on another two-year contract.

Ten months later, Stidham is set to start for Denver against New England in the AFC Championship game on Sunday following Bo Nix's season-ending ankle injury. After practice on Wednesday, Stidham was asked about his decision to re-sign with the Broncos in 2025.

‚ÄúThere are always opportunities out there and stuff, but I think at the end of the day, there was a combination of things that went into my decision to come back here," Stidham said. "I believe in Sean [Payton], and Davis [Webb] and Joe [Lombardi], and our room, and being behind Bo and helping him grow. I take a lot of pride in that.

"I felt like, over the last two years that I was here, that I got a lot better. I think the way Davis has coached us over these last three years now has really helped all of us improve. That‚Äôs just one thing I wanted to come back and be a part of. I felt like being here the last two years, and coming in with Sean, and signing and everything, it‚Äôs pretty evident that he has the train rolling in the right direction. I don‚Äôt think anybody can argue that, and I wanted to be a part of it.‚Äù

Stidham was one of Payton's first free agent signings when the coach arrived in 2023, and Payton has made it clear that he has faith in Stidham. After three years in a backup role, Stidham now gets an opportunity to step up and make history. Sunday's game (1:00 p.m. MT) will be nationally televised on CBS (more TV info).
